name: nn0subm

body.origin:
|- wcel(cn0, cfv(csubmnd, ccnfld))
-| wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cn0), wcel(cv(hs0), cc))
-| wi(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cn0), wcel(cv(hs1), cn0)), wcel(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cv(hs1)), cn0))
-| wcel(nat0, cn0)
-| diffss(hs0, hs1)
-| diffsc(hs0, cn0)
-| diffsc(hs1, cn0)
body.pretty:
⊢ ℕ0 ∈(SubMnd ` CCfld)
⊣ (hs0 ∈ ℕ0 → hs0 ∈ ℂ)
⊣ ((hs0 ∈ ℕ0 ∧ hs1 ∈ ℕ0)→(hs0[+]hs1)∈ ℕ0)
⊣ 0 ∈ ℕ0
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)
⊣ d(hs0, ℕ0)
⊣ d(hs1, ℕ0)

comment: The nonnegative integers form a submonoid of the complex numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jun-2015.)
